unnormalised: Hey everyone, chai pe charcha about social media virality is always interesting, isn't it? In the ever-evolving landscape of Instagram Reels, YouTube Shorts, and even the good ol' Facebook, what makes content truly pop off like Diwali crackers? unnormalised: One thing we’ve definitely noticed is the rise of hyper-local content. Think hilarious sketches about navigating Mumbai local trains or recipe videos featuring your grandmother's secret recipe for Lucknowi biryani. People connect with authenticity and relatable situations. Remember that video of the bride dancing at her wedding to a Bollywood remix back in 2021? That went viral because it was real, joyous, and very Indian.

unnormalised: Another big trend is using trending audio clips and challenges. If you aren't jumping on the "Bachpan ka Pyaar" bandwagon, you're missing out, yaar! These challenges offer a low barrier to entry and allow creators to put their own spin on a popular format. Think of it as a modern-day Bhajan mandali, but instead of singing devotional songs, you’re lip-syncing to Badshah.

A lot of NGOs use this as an effective marketing strategy to spread awareness and gain followers.

unnormalised: But virality isn’t just about luck. It’s about understanding your audience, using the right hashtags (think #DesiVibes, #IndiaTrends), and posting consistently. Don't forget to track your analytics and see what's working! Did that Reel you posted on 15/08/1947 (Independence Day!) perform better than the one you posted at 09:00 hrs on a regular Tuesday? Data is your best friend.
